Aliquots of water samples were divided as necessary for the measurement of each analyte following standard methods outlined in Table 2 and briefly described here. Water color was determined on an unfiltered water sample by visual comparison to a platinum-cobalt standard. Conductivity, pH and ANC were measured electrometrically using a calibrated Orion or YSI glass electrode. Conductivity and pH where measured directly, with pH measured in the field immediately after collection, while ANC was measured using Gran titration
39 .
